thread.title: Cape Verde qualify for AFCON round of 16 after thrashing Mozambique
thread.title_full: Cape Verde qualify for AFCON round of 16 after thrashing Mozambique

author: VNExplorer
title: Cape Verde qualify for AFCON round of 16 after thrashing Mozambique
text:
By Kazeem Ugbodaga
Impressive Cape Verde have qualified for the round of 16 at the ongoing African Cup of Nations (AFCON) after thrashing Mozambique 3-0 on Friday.
Cape Verde now have six points and are Group B winner after just two matches. They will remain top of the group even if they lose their last match to Egypt as they are unassailable.
Bebe opened the scoring for the tiny Island country in the 32nd minute of the match. He sent the ball into the net from a long-distance direct free kick. It went exactly inside the right post.
Cape Verde doubled their lead six minutes into the second half. A mistake from the defence gifted a chance to a lurking Ryan Mendes, who kept his cool and rolled the ball into the net from close range.
In the 59th minute of the game, Geny Catamo took a mid-range free kick and his effort flew straight, but crashes against the crossbar.
Midway into the second half, Cape Verde were 3-0 up. Kevin Lenini scored one of the best goals in his career. His rocket of a shot from distance went straight inside the left post.
Earlier, Bebe tried his luck from a long-range free kick, but the effort came back off the crossbar.
Provided by SyndiGate Media Inc. (Syndigate.info).
